description:
Leptospira montravelensis is a species of bacteria belonging to the genus Leptospira. It is a spiral-shaped, motile, and obligately aerobic bacterium. Leptospira montravelensis was first isolated from soil samples collected in Montravail, France.

The bacteria are classified as a member of the Leptospiraceae family within the phylum Spirochaetes. Leptospira montravelensis is considered a saprophytic leptospira, meaning it is not typically associated with causing disease in humans or animals, unlike some pathogenic Leptospira species.

Genetically, Leptospira montravelensis is distinct from other Leptospira species and has been shown to have a unique 16S rRNA gene sequence. It is believed to play a role in environmental cycling of nutrients, but its precise ecological functions are still under investigation by microbiologists and environmental scientists.
